required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Prostate Cancer Imaging With Radioactive Tracer and Ultrasound Detector Compared to MRI and ProstaScint
clinical_study.official_title: Exploratory Evaluation of a Transrectal Scintigraphic Detector (Proxiscan) for Detection of Primary Prostate Cancer Utilizing a Radiotracer Targeting Prostate Specific Membrane Antigen (PMSA)

lead_sponsor.agency: Radiological Associates of Sacramento Medical Group Inc.

clinical_study.source: Radiological Associates of Sacramento Medical Group Inc.

brief_summary.textblock: This is a small study to determine if probe, similar to an ultrasound probe, can detect prostate cancer more specifically than other imaging studies in patients with a positive prostate cancer biopsy.

primary_outcome.measure: Detection of PSMA antibody (ProstaScint)uptake patterns measured by Proxiscan in comparison with anatomic biopsy reports, conventional SPECT and MRI scans within one month of Proxiscan
primary_outcome.time_frame: Within on month of scan and corresponding MRI
primary_outcome.description: Detection of PSMA antibody (ProstaScint) uptake patterns measured by the new transrectal compact gamma camera (Proxiscan) will be compared to the anatomic biopsy reports along with Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI) and conventional ProstaScint (Single Photon Emission Computed Tomography) SPECT imaging results. All imaging and biopsy results performed within one month will be used for this investigation

arm_group.description: All consenting patients will be imaged with the Proxiscan and data compared with MRI, ProstaScint and biopsy data

intervention.description: All patients will be imaged with the device

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Primary prostate cancer proven by sextant prostate biopsy
- Transrectal ultrasound (TRUS)-guided prostate biopsy within 6 months of study enrollment
- Sufficient time period to complete imaging protocol and 5-7 day safety followup assessment without other therapeutic intervention
- In the judgement of principal investigator, patient able to provide informed consent and be compliant with protocol requirements
- ECOG status of 0 or 1 Pt > 18 yrs of age
Exclusion Criteria:
- Definitive or concomitant therapeutic intervention within the interval of study intervention
- Prior pelvic therapeutic radiation
- Active malignancy or therapy for malignancy with 6 months other than basal or squamous cell carcinoma of the skin
- Pt received radiopharmaceutical which was within 5 half-lives at the time of studying imaging
- Known history of human-anti-murine-antibodies or known allergic reaction to previously received murine based products

overall_official.affiliation: Radiological Associates of Sacramento Medical Group Inc.

facility.name: Roseville PET and Nuclear Imaging Center
